newsitem.title: ITALY: Alenia taking stake in Airbus and jet project.
newsitem.headline: Alenia taking stake in Airbus and jet project.

text.p: The Italian manufacturer Alenia will take a stake in the European aircraft maker Airbus Industrie and its project to develop a new "super" jumbojetliner, the managing director of Alenia's parent company said Tuesday.

Bruno Steve, managing director of Finmeccanica, told reporters that Alenia expected to take a 10 percent stake in the Airbus A3XX project to build a 555-seat jumbojet and a 15 percent stake in a project for a new 100-seat aircraft.

"We will join Airbus with the value of our assets and we will obtain shares in the company. We will certainly have positions on the board," Steve said. "The intention is to see all our efforts in Airbus recognised," he added.
The existing Airbus partners are Aerospatiale of France, Daimler-Benz of Germany, British Aerospace Plc and Construcciones Aeronauticas SA, known as Casa, of Spain.
The partners reached an agreement with Alenia in December calling for the Italian manufacturer to take a stake in the consortium.
Steve did not say how large Alenia's stake in the consortium would be.
The agreement called for Alenia and Airbus Industrie to form a new company for the 100-seater project and manage European participation in a joint venture with China and Singapore.
